content: It is a great application. It makes easy to learn.
Doesn't seem to work properly on Android 11.
This is the app I wanted to code but I'm not a programmer. Learning Morse? Get this. Want to increase your speed? Get this.
The RSS feed to Morse code is terrific and very good at gaining ability to do QSO's.
I like the app however its more for listening and learning the sounds not so much to practice sending, tapping the letters
Some nice features. Being able to input letters as they are sounded is cool. Any updates coming? I have many suggestions.
No tap input.

App is great, however it stays in idle mode after closing and drains my battery. Have not found a way to get the app out of idle mode so it closes and does not drain my battery. Will rate higher once this is fixed.
The display did not switch to training mode. I was hoping to find Koch format lessons starting with k and m, and slowly progressing to other letters. Did not see any option to do it

Excellent so far! Ive been looking for a way to learn morse for fifty years. i discovered the Koch method which seemed made for smartphones. Within a very short space of time of installing KMT Pro i found i was "seeing" letters in my head from the sound without trying to decode the dots and dashes. A way to go yet but very impressed so far.

works real well on my samsung tablet with a pair of headphones. Sound quality is ok it doesnt seem to be distorted. Sometimes when I miss a character it gives me credit for a correct answer. Not sure whats up there. It takes a lot of practice to learn the code, but this seeems to help.
Love this, sounds like the Koch method is official and effective. I only wish there was a mode to practice sending Morse code manually.
I wish there was an option to disable audio and use vibration instead. I would like the ability to learn both audio and vibration.

This is a very comprehensive trainer, one I will enjoy using. My only issue is that the RSS feed output starts jumping from the top of the screen down to the bottom, then back up again between each word, once the text reaches the bottom of the window and has to start scrolling the visible window. This is stomach churning if you're trying to read while listening to the code. Otherwise, this is a really good tutor.
This is an excellent learning aid with the ability to adjust the speed and timing of characters and word spacing is great.
With all letters enabled and running in random mode it only sends K and M.  Flawed ap not worth the money.

The best morse trainer I came across. The keyboard input is extremely useful when "on the go" and no writing pad at hand. The statistics and the ability to practice with RSS feeds make this the perfect app for me.

Excellent app. Purchased it a few years ago. Please bring it back for new 
users.

This app plus the Morse Trainer CW trainer app is all you need to learn and 
or advance your code copying speed. I've been a Ham for over fifty years 
and these two apps restored my former coping speed to 24+ WPM after being 
off CW for more than 20 years

I'm really disappointed in this. How am I supposed to interact with this thing? Yeah, OK, I can set my WPM and tones, but what good is that if I can't respond to the display? Where is my keyer? Am I supposed to type what I think the character being ditted and dahed at me after the fact? Any help would be appreciated.

I like it despite the wackiness.  In the random character strings, you need to ignore the first and last characters.  Otherwise, it's great.  I like the fact that I can enter custom text-I use Dr. Suess for practice.
Only complaint I have is it would be great if one could set longer playing Time, 30min for me is to Short.
The best app! Perfect, not just for learning but increasing speed too! Thanks!

I can easily contribute my success in learning mores code to this app.  The ability to adjust virtually everything is amazing.  I also like the HF background noise option, so smart.  Fantastic job and a well deserved 5 stars!
As other reviews stated, kmt Pro has great and useful variability.  I particularly like setting char speed at 30 +/- and the word speed slower and then work on increasing word speed.

I love this app format, but cannot use it currently due to some weird 'echoing' and 'clicking' in the morse tone sound.  This occurs even when the 'noise' function is set to zero.   Worse when 'noise' function is enabled.  I've also ensured that any audio enhancement settings/apps on my phone are removed/disabled.  This behavior occurs with headphones, or the builtin speaker.  No difference.  Great potential for this app, really hope the audio wierdness gets addressed in an update.  Not usable in current state with my particular phone (Samsung S7 Edge, Verizon default settings US, no mods)
Fantastic app. Lots of options for source text, including RSS feeds, means you won't get bored. Using it to increase my speed. Highly recommend it.

The best morse trainer I have found for any platform and I've tried a few! The edge it has is that when paired with a bluetooth keyboard you can practise copying and have your work assessed. It is a very nice way to train.

I have tried at least 4 different CW practice apps, and I have to say, I like this app the best. The user interface is very simple to use and since it teaches using the Koch method, I give it 5 stars!

I like being able to listen to RSS feeds and vary my practice sessions. I'd also like to be able to use the Share feature in other apps to send text to it for translation into morse like custom text, but easier to populate.

Of all the morse tutors I've tried this is my favourite. It's very flexible in how you can set it up and yet is very easy to use straight out of the box. My only criticism is that practicing morse properly should involve practicing sending as well as receiving. Sadly, like so many, this app is let down by not having this capability. The only app which 'does it all' is 'Morse Code Trainer' (and is free).  But for practicing receiving (only) this is definitely the best out there, and I've tried them all.
I'm lovin' it!
... system screen keyboard may hide the most important controls of the app. A little interface rearrangement would be appreciated.

My speed increased tremendously last year when I listened to the random words during my commute.. I did that for a couple months and I went from about 18 wpm to well over 30 wpm. Thanks! #! EDIT! Reading other reviews, I found out about the RSS feed feature.. WHAT! This is awesome! I used to download files from arrl to my phone and listen, what a pain.. The feed is a great idea.. 6 stars!

This is the best trainer I have tried.  I like it better than the koch trainer on my iPad.  The noise feature really helps getting used to copying over the air.  The RSS feed is great also. No memorizing the same code sent over and over. Don't waste your money on any other trainer this is all you need. 73 Steve
The best CW learning tool just got better! RSS feeds? What a great idea! Wish I thought of it. ;-)
The best trainer I've seen. The rss feed is also great. It would be nice to have a mode where the app automatically reads back the words. Keep it up.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback Jan. I'll add this in the next release. Cheers.

content: So perfectly detailed, and the improvements are immense! Love the RSS feed. Please keep up the hard work, it is greatly appreciated! 73 M0ZMS
This is a good program, but how do you stop it from running. I even exited back to my home page and still it runs.  I had to Force stop it.  Put a halt function key somewhere please.
replyContent: Can you please contact me to resolve this issue. My contact details are on the app listing. Thanks.

content: Peter went WAY above and beyond to fix an issue found with the LG devices.
Great Morse App
An amazingly handy CW trainer and the Author is super responsive and helpful
Not much better than the free versions out there, if any better at all. Input mode is awkward to use, and the screen doesn't adjust for your keyboard so the control buttons get covered.
replyContent: Setting added to v2.1 which adjusts layout for keyboard.

content: Runs without any problem,  well tested!

Nice program for training, but the way stats are computed, once you miss a character, pretty much all the rest is considered a 'miss' unless you are lucky. A better way to do stats would be to realign the stats at the start of each group, it would be much more accurate.
replyContent: This issue has been addressed in v2.1.

content: I love this app...the latest update made it even better!  Super customizable & it makes learning CW fun and easy...I've been practicing at lunch and I'm amazed at how quick I've picked it up.  Keep up the great work!
Very nice app
I used the previous version daily, this new version has everything I was missing and more.  More ham apps pls bit ninja!
This is exactly what I was looking for. Farnsworth timing and the Koch method for learning letters. Very configurable. By far the best Morse application I've found on this market.
Has all the features I was looking for and sounds great on my Nexus 7.

starting and stopping results in starting all over again.  if fails to restart after finishing, i had to hit say letter and then i could restart it.  little wierd on 4.2 but dev is addressing all my concerns.  excellent support.
Every feature I am looking for is included. Just buy this!
